genes.summary: BRAF, an intracellular kinase, is frequently mutated in melanoma, thyroid and lung cancers among others.
genes.background: BRAF is a serine/threonine kinase that plays a key role in the regulation of the mitogen-activated protein kinase (MAPK) cascade (PMID: 15520807), which under physiologic conditions regulates the expression of genes involved in cellular functions, including proliferation (PMID: 24202393). Genetic alterations in BRAF are found in a large percentage of melanomas, thyroid cancers and histiocytic neoplasms as well as a small fraction of lung and colorectal cancers. The most common BRAF point mutation is V600E, which deregulates the protein's kinase activity leading to constitutive BRAF activation, as BRAF V600E can signal as a monomer independently of RAS or upstream activation (PMID: 20179705). Other BRAF mutations have been found that affect the protein's propensity to dimerize (PMID: 16858395, 26343582, 12068308). The product of these alterations is a BRAF kinase that can activate MAPK signaling in an unregulated manner and, in some instances, is directly responsible for cancer growth (PMID: 15520807). Inhibitors of mutant BRAF, including vemurafenib and dabrafenib, are FDA-approved for the treatment of late-stage or unresectable melanoma.

variants.geneSummary: BRAF, an intracellular kinase, is frequently mutated in melanoma, thyroid and lung cancers among others.
variants.variantSummary: The BRAF V600E mutation is known to be oncogenic.

approvedIndications: Trametinib is FDA-approved for BRAF V600E or V600K mutant unresectable or metastatic melanoma

diagnostic.LEVEL_Dx1: FDA and/or professional guideline-recognized biomarker required for diagnosis in this indication
diagnostic.LEVEL_Dx2: FDA and/or professional guideline-recognized biomarker that supports diagnosis in this indication
diagnostic.LEVEL_Dx3: Biomarker that may assist disease diagnosis in this indication based on clinical evidence

prognostic.LEVEL_Px1: FDA and/or professional guideline-recognized biomarker prognostic in this indication based on well-powered studie(s)
prognostic.LEVEL_Px2: FDA and/or professional guideline-recognized biomarker prognostic in this indication based on a single or multiple small studies
prognostic.LEVEL_Px3: Biomarker is prognostic in this indication based on clinical evidence in well-powered studies

resistance.LEVEL_R1: Standard care biomarker predictive of resistance to an FDA-approved drug in this indication
resistance.LEVEL_R2: Compelling clinical evidence supports the biomarker as being predictive of resistance to a drug

sensitive.LEVEL_3A: Compelling clinical evidence supports the biomarker as being predictive of response to a drug in this indication
sensitive.LEVEL_3B: Standard care or investigational biomarker predictive of response to an FDA-approved or investigational drug in another indication
sensitive.LEVEL_2: Standard care biomarker recommended by the NCCN or other expert panels predictive of response to an FDA-approved drug in this indication
sensitive.LEVEL_4: Compelling biological evidence supports the biomarker as being predictive of response to a drug
sensitive.LEVEL_1: FDA-recognized biomarker predictive of response to an FDA-approved drug in this indication
